short.name: Glowshot Karaoke Tram
short.description: A neon-lit karaoke streetcar loops Kreuzberg while serving radioactive-looking cocktails.

short.name: The Spree Plunge
short.description: A 5-minute cold-dip pop-up in the river followed by instant espresso and group screaming.

short.name: Philosopher's Ping Pong
short.description: You lose a point every time you answer a question without citing Kant.

short.name: Techno Yoga Warmup
short.description: 40-minute Vinyasa under strobe lights, cued by a live DJ and someone whispering 'Surrender.'

short.name: Bauhaus Bootcamp
short.description: A design-themed HIIT class where instructors shout about symmetry and function over form.

short.name: The Apology Booth
short.description: Record an anonymous voicemail apology to your ex. It's broadcast on low-range FM.

short.name: Elevator Exhibition
short.description: 4-minute micro-art gallery inside a glass elevator. One ride only. No looping.

short.name: Dumpster Cheese Tasting
short.description: 'Sourced' from Berlin's eco scene; hosted by a very sincere man named Lutz.

short.name: Zine Speed-Dating
short.description: Trade self-published zines with strangers. No talking allowed. Judging is encouraged.

short.name: Late Capitalism Bingo
short.description: Spot ironic tattoos, unpaid interns, and startup founders in a curated Neukölln cafe.

short.name: Underwear Portrait Studio
short.description: 15-minute B&W film portraits taken in a drafty warehouse. Everyone's in their socks.

short.name: Cloud Bar
short.description: A rooftop with only water vapor, ASMR playlists, and zero drinks. You leave thirstier.

short.name: Berliner Bear-Hug Booth
short.description: One euro for 30 seconds of aggressive but affirming hugging from a man in a bear suit.

short.name: Rum Trader
short.description: Iconic, tiny bar where cocktails are sacred and phones are frowned upon.

short.name: Green Door
short.description: Retro speakeasy with velvet wallpaper and a bell you have to ring to enter.

short.name: Becketts Kopf
short.description: Literary-themed cocktail bar with deep vibes and old books behind the liquor.

short.name: Vabali Spa Happy Hour Sauna
short.description: A quick post-work sweat and plunge just west of Hauptbahnhof.

short.name: Clärchens Ballhaus Front Garden
short.description: Grab a quick spritz and hear accordion music in a 1913 dance garden.

short.name: Tempelhofer Feld
short.description: Join the 7pm joggers and kiteboarders on a decommissioned airport runway.

short.name: Bar Tausend
short.description: Hidden under the S-Bahn tracks, with brutalist design and pre-dinner DJ sets.

medium.name: Berliner Time Warp Café
medium.description: Each hour, the menu and music shift to a different decade. Waitstaff change accents accordingly.

medium.name: Currywurst Cabaret
medium.description: Dinner theater where each course triggers a new overly dramatic song about processed meat.

medium.name: Glowgarten
medium.description: LED-lit tables, synthy background beats, and glowing pretzels in an urban nature park.

medium.name: The Loft of Fables
medium.description: Multi-course dinner narrated by actors impersonating mythical Berlin creatures.

medium.name: Flamingo Forecast
medium.description: Your food, lighting, and music all change based on simulated Berlin weather patterns.

medium.name: Prosecco Poetry Arena
medium.description: One hour of slam poetry, two hours of shouting back positive affirmations over Prosecco refills.

medium.name: Late Stage Sitcom Bar
medium.description: Everything’s a sitcom here. You order, laugh track plays. Staff wear fake mics. It’s uncanny.

medium.name: Krautrock Sauna Sessions
medium.description: Sauna rounds timed to obscure 70s prog rock. Hydration stations serve herbal gin shots.

medium.name: Dinner & Drone Darts
medium.description: Throw darts at flying drones to win appetizers. Losers have to explain their startup idea.

medium.name: The Emotional Buffet
medium.description: Each buffet station represents a different feeling. No labels. Cry if necessary.

medium.name: Haus of Echo
medium.description: Your table wears synced headphones; conversations and menus shift based on BPM.

medium.name: Dinner at the End of Capitalism
medium.description: A communal dinner served by robots wearing anarchist patches. Menu in binary.

medium.name: Flaneur Feast
medium.description: Each course served at a different sidewalk. Staff on rollerblades. Philosophical prompts provided.

medium.name: Cookies Cream
medium.description: Hidden upscale vegetarian spot behind a loading dock — inventive, iconic, Berlin-core.

medium.name: Neni Berlin
medium.description: Glass-walled greenhouse rooftop with Mediterranean fusion and panoramic zoo views.

medium.name: Katz Orange
medium.description: Rustic-modern dishes in a brick courtyard with biodynamic wines and candlelight.

medium.name: Borchardt
medium.description: Old-school, high-ceilinged institution favored by celebrities, politicians, and power-lunchers.

medium.name: Mrs. Robinson’s
medium.description: Casual fine dining with big Berlin personality and ever-changing fusion plates.

medium.name: Grill Royal
medium.description: See-and-be-seen riverside steakhouse with big art, bold prices, and serious vibes.

medium.name: Tim Raue
medium.description: Precision-plated, wildly creative cuisine in a minimalist gallery-like space.

long.name: The Endless Basement
long.description: A club with no exits, just deeper levels. Each floor has stranger rules. You may forget your name.

long.name: Berliner Bureau of Lost Time
long.description: Once you enter, you must justify every hour you spend. Bureaucrats may detain you for emotional inconsistencies.

long.name: Scream Garden
long.description: Techno meets primal therapy in a fog-drenched courtyard full of whispering statues.

long.name: Club Nebel
long.description: No visuals. Just sound, mist, silhouettes, and the ghost of your ex's DJ set.

long.name: Kollektiv Collapse
long.description: Food, music, mutual aid, no bouncers. Leave when the compost starts fermenting.

long.name: Cicada Ball
long.description: Only happens once every 17 weeks. Guests must wear masks until dawn. Some stay masked forever.

long.name: Tanzflucht
long.description: You follow a silent disco van through alleys and over rooftops. If you fall behind, you’re out.

long.name: Night of 1,000 Outfit Changes
long.description: Every hour, you must change outfits. Clothing racks spin from the ceiling.

long.name: Chaos Choir
long.description: Instead of DJs, it’s screaming. Harmonized. Beautiful. Loud. You won't believe the drop.

long.name: Keller of Questions
long.description: Get in by answering a question. Stay by asking better ones. Exit by making someone cry.

long.name: Apokalounge
long.description: All furniture is scavenged. You trade favors for drinks. The playlist is collapse-core.

long.name: Library of Looping Desire
long.description: Every room has a different theme. You must catalog your night in footnotes.

long.name: Voidwerk
long.description: Each guest represents a concept. You are not allowed to break character until sunrise.

long.name: Berghain
long.description: Berlin’s infamous temple of sound, open into the late morning. Door policy is ruthless. Music is worth it.

long.name: Sisyphos
long.description: Beachy, burner-like club with art cars, hammocks, fire pits, and no clocks.

long.name: Kater Blau
long.description: Whimsical, colorful chaos right on the Spree. Expect surprise sunrise moments.

long.name: Ritter Butzke
long.description: Converted factory with themed rooms, gritty basslines, and dedicated regulars.

long.name: Watergate
long.description: Legendary house and techno spot with LED ceilings and panoramic Spree view.

long.name: Club der Visionaere
long.description: Low-key summer day-to-night institution. Come for the vibe, stay until you're barefoot.

long.name: Anomalie Art Club
long.description: A shifting warehouse party/art hybrid. Projectors, DJs, and mild time distortion.

short.name: Mini Elvis Off
short.description: Guests get one minute to out-Elvis each other. Winner gets a peanut butter martini.

short.name: Slot Machine Confessional
short.description: Pull the lever, hear a stranger's darkest secret, leave with a drink token.

short.name: Drive-Thru Compliment Tunnel
short.description: You're slowly driven through a glowing tunnel of actors giving you absurd praise.

short.name: Desert Limo Drift
short.description: Strap in for a high-speed limo donut session in a sand lot outside the Strip.

short.name: Bubble Gun Rodeo
short.description: Shoot biodegradable bubbles at robot clowns while riding a slow-moving bull.

short.name: Slot-Size Escape Room
short.description: You and a partner have 5 minutes to get out of a velvet-walled gambling closet.

short.name: Neon Haiku Bar
short.description: You only get served if you order your drink in perfect haiku form.

short.name: Cirque du Snack
short.description: Watch a 10-minute snack-themed acrobat set while eating popcorn on a podium.

short.name: Silent Slot Lounge
short.description: No sound. Just you, plush headphones, and machines that whisper affirmations.

short.name: Champagne Pong
short.description: Pairs play pong with flutes and foam. Winner takes the bottle, loser gets sprayed.

short.name: Velvet Tarot Drive-Up
short.description: Get a two-card reading while parked behind a velvet curtain near the Strip.

short.name: The Bribe Table
short.description: Sit at a circular table and try to bribe your way into dessert service.

short.name: Selfie Courtroom
short.description: Be judged for your Instagram crimes in a 5-minute mock trial with wigs.

short.name: Velveteen Rabbit
short.description: Trendy bar known for creative drinks, cozy interior, and backyard patio.

short.name: SkyBar at Waldorf Astoria
short.description: Chic rooftop with stunning Strip views and refined drink menu.

short.name: Atomic Liquors
short.description: Oldest freestanding bar in Vegas with retro charm and rooftop patio.

short.name: The Laundry Room
short.description: Secret entrance, strict reservations, and seriously artistic cocktails.

short.name: AREA15 Art Walk
short.description: Pop into art installations and wild shops at Vegas' immersive culture hub.

short.name: Fremont Street Zipline
short.description: Fly across Fremont under neon lights in under 2 minutes of screaming fun.

short.name: The Chandelier at Cosmopolitan
short.description: Have a quick cocktail inside a literal crystal chandelier.

medium.name: Slot Machine Story Hour
medium.description: Every time you pull a lever, an actor narrates a new chapter of your descent into capitalist chaos.

medium.name: Sin City Soup Supper
medium.description: Each course is based on a different vice and served by staff in Greco-Roman togas.

medium.name: Bingo & Betrayal
medium.description: Win prizes, lose friends. Guests are assigned secrets and must bluff through every round.

medium.name: Champagne Circus Training
medium.description: You’ll learn aerials after your second glass. Everyone signs a waiver. No one reads it.

medium.name: The Buffet of Broken Dreams
medium.description: A spoken-word MC guides you through lukewarm trays of existential dread and fondue.

medium.name: Omni-Karaoke Arena
medium.description: Six stages. One spotlight. You sing while rotating on a moving platform surrounded by pyrotechnics.

medium.name: The Influencer Scavenger Hunt
medium.description: Take selfies in 12 locations, capture 1 micro-celebrity, post 3 lies. Win drink credits.

medium.name: Glow Noodle Roller Rave
medium.description: LED ramen carts on wheels. Eat while skating. Watch the broth glow.

medium.name: Crypto Karaoke Confessional
medium.description: You sing. The crowd rates you. The blockchain decides if you drink top shelf or water.

medium.name: The Mirage Mirage
medium.description: A fake restaurant built inside a real restaurant that pretends to be another restaurant.

medium.name: Dinner in the Void
medium.description: Served in pitch black by whispering waiters. No forks. No escape until dessert.

medium.name: High Stakes Pictionary Lounge
medium.description: Draw terribly, win chips. If your team loses, your cocktail gets downgraded.

medium.name: Psychic Drag Dinner
medium.description: Get a tarot reading with your entrée and a roast with your dessert.

medium.name: Best Friend
medium.description: Roy Choi’s hip-hop blasted culinary mashup spot inside Park MGM.

medium.name: Carbone
medium.description: Red-sauce Vegas glam with tableside Caesar, spicy rigatoni, and Rat Pack swagger.

medium.name: Bazaar Meat by José Andrés
medium.description: Experimental proteins, cotton candy foie gras, and maximalist dining energy.

medium.name: Mayfair Supper Club
medium.description: Over-the-top lakeside supper with swing, sax, and seafood towers.

medium.name: Superfrico
medium.description: Acid-hued rooms, stilt walkers, and pizza that may or may not talk back.

medium.name: é by José Andrés
medium.description: Tiny 8-seat kitchen theater inside Jaleo. Liquid olives and surprise courses.

medium.name: Estiatorio Milos
medium.description: Elegant, upscale fish flown in daily and grilled simply. Yes, the octopus is perfect.

long.name: The Eternal Slot
long.description: One machine. One bet. It never ends. You win when you forget why you came.

long.name: Rooftop Rodeo Soirée
long.description: Three hours of champagne, saddle chafing, and slow-motion line dancing under pink floodlights.

long.name: Blackout Buffet Ballet
long.description: Dine in the dark while dancers interpret your food choices with interpretive swan movements.

long.name: Subterranean Champagne Labyrinth
long.description: 45 rooms. No maps. Every bottle leads deeper. You find the DJ, you get to leave.

long.name: The Simulation Suite
long.description: Put on a headset, meet a simulated version of yourself. Try not to fall in love.

long.name: Glowfight Lounge
long.description: Blacklight swordplay with marshmallow sabers. Each hit earns sips of edible glitter wine.

long.name: Ceiling Fan Cathedral
long.description: 300 synchronized ceiling fans create hypnotic rhythm. Drones serve dry martinis mid-air.

long.name: The Mirage Mirage Mirage
long.description: Each door opens to another version of the same club, slightly worse. You must escape by sunrise.

long.name: VIP Parking Garage Rave
long.description: Top floor of a spiral garage. Bass echoes off concrete. Attendees arrive via Lyft Lux only.

long.name: The High Stakes Haircut
long.description: You get a fade while gambling your drink limit on trivia rounds and old-school hip-hop lyrics.

long.name: Cirque de Filet
long.description: Three-hour tasting menu punctuated by aerialists, knife juggling, and increasingly dramatic salmon plating.

long.name: Y2K Basement Revival
long.description: Early 2000s fashion, flip phones, and choreographed dance breaks in a retro mall food court.

long.name: Truth or Tequila Arena
long.description: The crowd decides your fate: shots or secrets. Everything's livestreamed to a hotel lobby.

long.name: XS Nightclub
long.description: Encore’s luxurious, gold-dripping party palace with headliner DJs and a pool.

long.name: Omnia
long.description: Massive multi-room venue with kinetic chandeliers and open-til-dawn dancefloor.

long.name: Hakkasan
long.description: MGM Grand’s top-tier EDM destination with laser heaven and table service armies.

long.name: Drai’s Nightclub
long.description: High-energy rooftop club on the Strip with hip-hop focus and panoramic views.

long.name: Marquee
long.description: Cosmopolitan’s signature spot with theme rooms, deep beats, and electronic saturation.

long.name: Zouk
long.description: Tech-savvy dance space with floating orbs, rotating DJ booths, and full sensory overload.

long.name: The Mayfair Supper Club
long.description: Lake Bellagio-front dining with rotating jazz, burlesque, and four-hour tasting menus.

short.name: Pixel Zen Capsule
short.description: Sit inside a glowing cube while a pixelated monk guides your breathing via glitchy haikus.

short.name: Karaoke Elevator Duel
short.description: Battle a stranger in a two-minute song-off as you ascend 22 floors in Shinjuku.

short.name: Sakura Smoke Lab
short.description: Inhale cherry blossom vapor while your cocktail evaporates in reverse.

short.name: Gacha Philosophy Club
short.description: Pop a gacha machine and debate whatever concept comes out for five minutes max.

short.name: Robot Tea Ceremony
short.description: A perfectly imperfect tea ceremony hosted by a slightly glitchy service android.

short.name: Subway Haiku Slam
short.description: Compete to write 5-7-5 verses during a one-stop metro ride. Winner gets a melon soda.

short.name: Neko Joust Lounge
short.description: Pet a sleepy cat while watching live mini-lance battles between plush toys and lasers.

short.name: Emoji Omikuji
short.description: Receive a divine emoji forecast and then explain its implications to a priest hologram.

short.name: Bento Speed Assembly
short.description: Assemble a photogenic bento box in under 3 minutes while kawaii judges yell gently.

short.name: Otaku Whisper Cafe
short.description: Order in a whisper, converse in a murmur, tip in stickers. Violators get glared at.

short.name: Yokai Flash Mob
short.description: Join a pop-up monster parade through a convenience store. No questions allowed.

short.name: Bubblewrap Footpath
short.description: Walk barefoot across 15 meters of bubblewrap while city noise fades into ambient J-pop.

short.name: Shibuya Glitch Booth
short.description: Take a picture of your aura. Then take a picture of your future self. Then leave.

short.name: Trench
short.description: Absinthe-forward intimate bar in Ebisu with vintage vibes and incredible cocktails.

short.name: Gen Yamamoto
short.description: Seasonal fruit-based cocktail tasting menu in an ultra-minimalist setting.

short.name: Bar Benfiddich
short.description: Inventive mixology and hand-ground herbs served like potions in a cozy nook.

short.name: High Five
short.description: One of the world’s best Ginza bars — no menu, just precision and trust.

short.name: TeamLab Planets Tokyo
short.description: Surreal walk-through digital art installations. Can be done in under an hour if you rush.

short.name: Shibuya Sky
short.description: Panoramic sunset views over Tokyo with ambient music and skyline selfies.

short.name: Yoyogi Park Walk
short.description: Twilight walk through urban forest trails with lanterns, buskers, and peace.

medium.name: Sushi from the Sky
medium.description: Dine suspended midair by crane while drones deliver nigiri and ambient whispers.

medium.name: Emoji Kaiseki
medium.description: Every course is paired with a single emoji. You must decode the meaning to eat it.

medium.name: VHS Jazz Spa
medium.description: Soak your feet in warm sake while VHS jazz tapes project on steamy walls.

medium.name: Midnight Manga Banquet
medium.description: A multi-course feast with food inspired by famous manga scenes and served by cosplayers.

medium.name: Gachapon Gourmet Crawl
medium.description: Turn a capsule machine to decide your next bizarre food + drink combo location.

medium.name: Bento Duel: Chef vs Robot
medium.description: Chefs face off against AI-powered rice printers while the crowd shouts support in haiku.

medium.name: Shrine of 1,000 Vibes
medium.description: Wander a candlelit maze of micro bars themed by mood and lunar cycle.

medium.name: Purikura Dinner Theater
medium.description: Order courses while trapped inside a glamor-filtered karaoke photo booth.

medium.name: Otome Mystery Cafe
medium.description: You are the heroine. You choose your server’s backstory. You must survive dinner.

medium.name: The Bento Metaverse
medium.description: Every guest sees a different meal. Some can’t use chopsticks unless they prove themselves.

medium.name: Neon Silence Ceremony
medium.description: No talking. Just lighting cues, signal tones, and reactive drinkware.

medium.name: Yokai Tasting Club
medium.description: Each dish represents a Japanese ghost. The cocktails dare you to meet them.

medium.name: Train Car Omakase
medium.description: You eat as the train loops Tokyo. Each course reveals a new personal truth.

medium.name: Omakase Yui
medium.description: Premium chef’s choice sushi spot where counter seating = immersive spectacle.

medium.name: Afuri Ramen
medium.description: Citrus-kissed ramen in a sleek, clean space with automated efficiency.

medium.name: Ishikawa
medium.description: Three Michelin stars, countless tiny details. Hidden in an alley. Magical.

medium.name: Kyubey
medium.description: Legendary Ginza sushi with tradition, intimacy, and incredible precision.

medium.name: Teyandei
medium.description: Playful handwritten menus and cozy vibes in a Tokyo favorite with soul.

medium.name: Super Potato Retro Arcade
medium.description: Grab snacks, beers, and relive your pixelated glory on vintage consoles.

medium.name: Tokyo Dome City Spa LaQua
medium.description: Open late for soaking, lounging, and forgetting you’re in a megacity.

long.name: The Endless Izakaya
long.description: You stay seated. The staff changes. The lighting shifts. The night forgets its name.

long.name: Yokai Ramen Ritual
long.description: Eat 13 courses of ramen while actors in folklore costumes chant under flickering lanterns.

long.name: The Capsule Hotel Casino
long.description: Every capsule is a different theme. You gamble with secrets, not chips.

long.name: Digital Shrine Bar Hop
long.description: Scan a QR code at each bar. Complete all 7 trials to unlock a cocktail from the gods.

long.name: Glitchwave Metro Party
long.description: A subway train that never stops. Every car is a new DJ, every station more surreal.

long.name: Kigurumi Battle Lounge
long.description: Dress as your inner creature. Dance, duel, or nap in beanbags as judged by a plush deity.

long.name: Ghibli Noir Cabaret
long.description: A smoky reimagining of childhood dreams, served with miso martinis and jazz ghosts.

long.name: Hyper Shrine Sleepover
long.description: Midnight tarot, omamori crafting, and dream journaling under synthetic moonlight.

long.name: Purikura Speed Love
long.description: Each hour, you switch partners and print a new photo-booth memory. Plotlines get weird fast.

long.name: The Bento Gauntlet
long.description: Can you eat 12 tiny bentos while a panel of judges rates your chopstick etiquette live?

long.name: Whisper Karaoke Mansion
long.description: Three floors of silent pop. Sing in a whisper or get escorted out by mime security.

long.name: Mirror Club 7
long.description: A techno club where every surface is reflective. The DJ remixes your heartbeat.

long.name: Emoji Spa Experience
long.description: Each hot spring pool is based on an emoji. Your soak is algorithmically matched to your soul.

long.name: Womb
long.description: Iconic four-floor Shibuya club with massive sound and visuals. Ends late (if ever).

long.name: Contact Tokyo
long.description: Basement venue for deep sounds, progressive vibes, and sunrise exits.

long.name: AgeHa
long.description: Tokyo’s biggest party complex with outdoor pool, multiple rooms, and ferry service.

long.name: VENT
long.description: Audiophile-friendly techno cave in Omotesando. No phones, no distractions, all sound.

long.name: Bonobo
long.description: Two floors of vinyl, soul, and incense-smoke charm in a converted house.

long.name: Forestlimit
long.description: For the weirdos. Left-field performances, tiny crowd, cosmic after-midnight feels.

long.name: LaQua Spa at Tokyo Dome City
long.description: 24-hour hot spring and lounge with food, pools, and robe-based wanderlust.
